meanings.definition: A person who is highly skilled or successful in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The young artist became one of the hotshots in the art world.
meanings.sent2: The hotshots in the basketball team led their group to victory.
meanings.sent3: The hotshots in the cooking competition were on fire!
meanings.sent4: She was a hotshot in solving puzzles, always finishing first.
meanings.sent5: The hotshots in the business world knew how to make deals that others couldn't.

meanings.definition: A shot of liquor that is heated before being consumed.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, he enjoyed a hotshot of whiskey to relax.
meanings.sent2: The bartender prepared a hotshot of brandy for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The hotshot of tequila warmed him up on the chilly evening.
meanings.sent4: She felt the hotshot of rum spread warmth through her body.
meanings.sent5: The hotshot of vodka was just what he needed to unwind after work.
